question: I am 33 years old, I recently gained weight rapidly (70lbs in a year)  without a change in diet. My question is "Is there a link that may cause all of my conditions?"I went to five doctors and was diagnosied with chornic fatique syndrome(didn't buy it) and tested for cushings syndrome(ruled out).  The last doctor I went to ran tests on me which showed:  Hietal Hernia, Elevated insulin levels,(more than double normal range) with diabetes type II, elevated liver enzymes, (High levels) hypothyroidism (TSH 90 triple normal valves) postive ANA,(low titers?) positive CMV said proably had when I was younger. I have had several kidney infections this year.  Upper abdominal pain constant dull ache (pressure feeling) Weird thing about this sometimes it is on the right side sometimes on the left side sometimes spread across the entire area under my breast.Symptoms:cushing like symptoms(along with striking physical charteristics), both the doctor and I both felt this was the case however cortisoil levels were within normal range after a 24 hour urine,  but this was before we found out I had diabetes.  Joint pain and weakness, stomach pain sharp lower right side and full dull pain across stomach switching sides.  Uncomfortable.  FATT Liver (ultrasoud)  Lower back pain (it feels bruised)  Freguent urination and I do not completely empty my bladder.  Abnormal menstrual cycle. (Periods that last several weeks.) Blurred vision, shakes. Numbness and tingling in feet/hands/mouth. This is too much for a young mother of two if you ask me.  I do not drink by the way, a couple of Dr.'s asked that.  Is there a link?_________Dear beth,Hypothyroidism can explain the weight gain, fatigue and if you have gastroparesis the abdominal pain.  Has your doctor initiated thyroid replacement?  If GI symptoms persist yopu should discuss with your physician the possibilities of barium study of upper GI tract and intestine as well as a nuclear medicine gastric emptying study.This information is presented for educational purposes only.  Always discuss specific medical questions with your personal physician.HFHSM.D.-rf*keywords; hypothyroidism, weight, gastroparesis0.2
title: Where do I began diabetes, hypothyroidisum, elevated liver enzymes, linked?????
